albumData.title: 151018 Fixing lamp liner with glove balloon

media.description: The lamp on the left has a diffusing liner that has come loose and needs repair.
media.title: 20151018_145017.jpg

media.description:
The loose diffusing liner needs to be repaired.  
I need an adhesive that holds fast with large swings in temperature.
The shape presents a tricky clamping problem while the adhesive sets.
media.title: 20151018_145032.jpg

media.description: The liner has come loose and has been warped by getting too close to the light bulb.
media.title: 20151018_145047.jpg

media.description:
To make matters worse, the liner is brittle, here you can see that pieces have chipped away at the slightest manipulation.
I decided that the best adhesive would be silicone RTV.  It sticks like crazy to everything, has an elastic bond, and works well with heat.
media.title: 20151018_145711.jpg

media.description: I inflated the glove and gently crammed it down into the lamp where it will exert a steady firm gentile pressure while the silicone sets.
media.title: 20151018_150637.jpg
